Titles CURTAIN GOING UP II
Type: Talk
Time: 14:30
No.: 13 to finish series
Origin: Don Buell-WKAR
Audience: General
Serial Number: 56-36
Release Date: Upon arrival
Fifteen minutes of theatre news and reviews from Broadway and elsewhere: a summary
of the current season with reviews of the major hits, biographical data on the
stars, producers, directors, designers and others responsible for producing plays
and musicals in the professional theatre.
Mr. Buell is a professor of speech at Michigan State University. For eleven years
he served as Director of Dramatics until 1953 when he withdrew to devote his
extra-curricular time to CURTAIN GOING UP. His background is unique in that he
has been an active playgoer on Broadway since 1927, making annual trips to Times
Square to attend the plays. He has been teaching dramatics since 1934, starting
at the University of Nebraska and moving to Michigan State. He is in demand as
a lecturer on the current Broadway season and his course, Contemporary American
Theatre, is offered each term. His enthusiasm for the theatre has done much to
arouse interest in "the road" for the state of Michigan
Since the nature of this series dictates against advanced programming, we are
unable to give you the definite titles for the programs in the series. As the
current Broadway season rolls on, we will have some definite titles to pass
along to you.
